title: Strongest Correlation
question_text: Which of the following scatterplots show the strongest linear correlation?
solution:
The strongest correlation will have points that are closest to a straight line. If this line is increasing from left to right, the slope is positive and the correlation will approach
1
. If this line is decreasing from left to right, the slope is negative and the correlation will approach
−
1
. Correlations of
1
and
−
1
are considered to be equally strong.

Choice 'E' is correct; because we can see immediately that this scatterplot has points that form most closely to a single line, it has the strongest correlation and is close to
−
1
. Remember, the strongest correlation will be near
−
1
or near
1
.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; this plot has only a moderately weak positive correlation.

Choice 'B' is incorrect; this plot has a strong pattern, but it is NOT linear.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; this plot shows some pattern, but there is NO linear correlation with this model.

Choice 'D' is incorrect; this plot shows a moderately strong correlation, but not nearly as strong as that of Choice 'E'.
